content:
• Monday, March 4, 2013
  • MRC

    MRC Global (NYSE:MRC) says that PVF Holdings, its majority stockholder, has commenced a...

    MRC Global (NYSE:MRC) says that PVF Holdings, its majority stockholder, has commenced a registered underwritten public offering of 17M shares. The company will not receive any of the proceeds of the offering. Goldman Sachs, Barclays and Baird are all joint-bookrunning managers. Shares -1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) announces plans for underwritten public offering of 5.375M...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) announces plans for underwritten public offering of 5.375M shares of its stock held by certain shareholders. JAZZ will not receive any proceeds from the offering. Barclays is acting as sole book-running manager for the offering. Shares -2.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 PM
  • ASNA

    More on Ascena Retail (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 handily beats bottom line estimates. Net earnings fell...

    More on Ascena Retail (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 handily beats bottom line estimates. Net earnings fell 26% Y/Y however, as the women's apparel retailer continued to rack up heavy charges from acquisitions as well as and other costs, masking solid sales growth. Shares +14.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • AMRX

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL) gets hammered after FDA inspectors say they've found continuing...

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL) gets hammered after FDA inspectors say they've found continuing problems at the company's Hayward, California manufacturing facility that may affect new and pending drug applications. Issues the agency found include problems related to the testing and evaluation processes for its Parkinson's drug candidate Rytary, as well as other products. Inspectors also said the company failed to identify the cause of broken tablets of its anti-inflammatory drug Carprofen. Shares -18.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPWR

    Shares of Compuware (NASDAQ:CPWR) are active in the post-trading session as buyout chatter is...

    Shares of Compuware (NASDAQ:CPWR) are active in the post-trading session as buyout chatter is revived. The company is reportedly getting interest from several private equity firms, including Thoma Bravo, Apax, Hellman & Friedman, and Golden Gate. Last month the stock spiked on chatter that the company was in early talks with P-E firms Blackstone and TPG, among others, after shooting down an $11/share offer made by Elliott Associates in January. Shares +4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM
  • ASNA

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ASNA +13%. SNTS +8%. CPWR +4%. NDZ +3%. MTG +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ASNA +13%. SNTS +8%. CPWR +4%. NDZ +3%. MTG +3%.
    After-hours top losers: IPXL -20%. JCP -6%. GMXR -6%. TVL -3%. NSU -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • SNHY

    Sun Hydraulics (NASDAQ:SNHY): Q4 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $43.2M (-5% Y/Y) beats...

    Sun Hydraulics (NASDAQ:SNHY): Q4 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $43.2M (-5% Y/Y) beats by $1.8M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • WPZ

    Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) -3.4% AH after announcing plans for a public offering of 10M common...

    Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) -3.4% AH after announcing plans for a public offering of 10M common units and a concurrent private placement of 3M common units to Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) WPZ plans to use the net proceeds to pay down debt and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) falls another 4.8% AH as a secondary offering of 10M shares is being...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) falls another 4.8% AH as a secondary offering of 10M shares is being marketed by Deutsche, presumably - says one trader - for Vornado Realty Trust (NYSE:VNO).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • APPCQ

    American Apparel (APP): Q4 EPS of $0.04. Revenue of $173M (+10% Y/Y). Shares +10% AH. (PR)

    American Apparel (APP): Q4 EPS of $0.04. Revenue of $173M (+10% Y/Y). Shares +10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy Group (NASDAQ:REGI): Q4 Revenue of $232M (-13% Y/Y). Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)

    Renewable Energy Group (NASDAQ:REGI): Q4 Revenue of $232M (-13% Y/Y). Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • Z

    A secondary is on the way for Trulia (TRLA) as the company files an S-1. In other news,...

    A secondary is on the way for Trulia (TRLA) as the company files an S-1. In other news, Caledonia Investments reports a 13.51% passive stake in the company. Shares -5.2% AH. Update at 4:45: The offering will be for $100M worth of shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.23B in-line....

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA): FQ2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.23B in-line. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • AAU

    Almaden Minerals (AAU -6.1%) agrees to sell its 100% interest in four gold/silver properties in...

    Almaden Minerals (AAU -6.1%) agrees to sell its 100% interest in four gold/silver properties in Mexico and two gold properties in Nevada to Tarsis Resources (OTC:TARSF) for 4M common shares and a 2% net smelter returns royalty on any production from the projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX -2.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Goldman Sachs, citing...

    Consol Energy (CNX -2.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Goldman Sachs, citing outperformance vs. other coal stocks due to a strong balance sheet, less exposure to declines in met coal prices, and diversification. The firm sees greater upside in Buy-rated Cloud Peak Energy (CLD -0.5%) and Neutral-rated Peabody (BTU -1.3%), which have lagged.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • TGT

    Retail rush: Target (TGT +3.5%) trades higher as some investors take the bet that lower oil...

    Retail rush: Target (TGT +3.5%) trades higher as some investors take the bet that lower oil prices might put enough cash back into the pockets of consumers to spur on spending. Also on the move: Wal-Mart (WMT +2%), Costco (COST +1.7%), and Dollar General (DG +2.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • HEB

    Hemispherx BioPharma (HEB +0.7%) settles back to trade only marginally higher today, after...

    Hemispherx BioPharma (HEB +0.7%) settles back to trade only marginally higher today, after popping nearly 15% in premarket action after the company's Alferon Injection was approved by Argentina's regulatory agency. Alferon N Injection is an FDA-approved natural interferon and, as Naturaferon, is already approved in Argentina for the treatment of refractory or recurring external genital warts.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • HES

    CEO John Hess says plans to reshape Hess (HES +3.5%) into a pure-play oil exploration and...

    CEO John Hess says plans to reshape Hess (HES +3.5%) into a pure-play oil exploration and production company have nothing to do with criticism from Elliott Management: "Elliott got on the train after if left the station." Elliott sees it differently, taking credit for sparking action but finding the Hess proposal "falls dramatically short of what is needed." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • APEI

    For-profit education stocks sink lower as debate rages in Washington DC over funding for student...

    For-profit education stocks sink lower as debate rages in Washington DC over funding for student loans.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • DVAX

    Dynavax (DVAX -7.6%) takes a hit today after the company reported a wider Q4 net loss late...

    Dynavax (DVAX -7.6%) takes a hit today after the company reported a wider Q4 net loss late Friday of $20.1 million late Friday, or $0.11 per share, more than the $4.3 million loss the same quarter a year prior. Analysts anticipated a loss of $0.08 per share. Revenues also came up short at $1.8M, down from $11.4M for the prior year period, and well under the $6.9M analysts expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • DCTH

    Delcath (OTC:DCTH +10.4%) resumes its trek higher again today, adding to its run over the past...

    Delcath (OTC:DCTH +10.4%) resumes its trek higher again today, adding to its run over the past few sessions. Late last week, the company said the FDA's Oncologic Drugs Advisory Committee will review a new drug application for it's Melblez KitTM for Injection drug/device combination for use with the Delcath Hepatic Delivery System.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • FOR

    Forestar Group's (FOR +11.5%) shares trade at a 40% discount to net asset value, a discount that...

    Forestar Group's (FOR +11.5%) shares trade at a 40% discount to net asset value, a discount that isn't likely to persist, Barron's said in a weekend article. With the housing market improving, FOR is accelerating its sales of residential lots and investing the proceeds in higher-returning ventures, including its oil and gas business and real estate development properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.2%) is the Dow's worst performer today amid renewed concerns about economic...

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.2%) is the Dow's worst performer today amid renewed concerns about economic growth in China. As China looks to curb rising home prices, the likely result would be lower demand for basic materials. The impact is hitting heavy equipment manufacturers such as Joy Global (JOY -3.9%), diversified miners including Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -6%), and steelmakers (SLX -2.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -3.2%) slips after a cautious mention on Twitter by Citron Research,...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG -3.2%) slips after a cautious mention on Twitter by Citron Research, saying hospitals are beginning to question the value of robotic surgery. The tweet links to an article in the Monterey Herald that infers ISRG's da Vinci system is nothing more than "razzle-dazzle marketing," and questions whether the $2m price tag is justified.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASRT

    Depomed (DEPO) resumes trading, currently down 10% at $5.96.

    Depomed (DEPO) resumes trading, currently down 10% at $5.96.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN -2.3%) slips today, despite reaffirming its FY13 outlook. The company says...

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN -2.3%) slips today, despite reaffirming its FY13 outlook. The company says it's anticipating its EPS at the higher end of its guidance range of $1.55 - $1.58, in line with the Street consensus of $1.58. It also maintains FY13 revenue at the higher end of its $575M - $585M range as well. Analysts are looking for $583.3M. However, Oppenheimimer cut its price target on the shares after Noridian, the Medicare contractor for Utah, reduced Integrated BRACAnalysis pricing by 16.3%. MYGN gets 10% of its revenue from Medicare.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU +2.5%) bucks a weak day for Chinese stocks to trade higher in front of the company's...

    Qihoo (QIHU +2.5%) bucks a weak day for Chinese stocks to trade higher in front of the company's earnings report scheduled for tomorrow. Sentiment is getting swayed by a positive note out from T.H. Capital which points to a boost in online shopping sales and web game hosting activity for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +24%) soars after after a NY state judge denies Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) petition...

    MBIA (MBI +24%) soars after after a NY state judge denies Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) petition to overturn the insurer's 2009 restructuring. This ruling doesn't appear to affect a parallel suit between the two regarding putbacks.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • HMG

    Midday top 10 gainers: HMG +96%. FOE +33%. HGSH +20%. NQ +18%. MTG +17%. OTCPK:TELOZ +17%. PRAN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: HMG +96%. FOE +33%. HGSH +20%. NQ +18%. MTG +17%. OTCPK:TELOZ +17%. PRAN +15%. OTT +15%. OUTD +15%. YOD +13%.
    Midday top 10 losers: DRWI -22%. SCSS -16%. AT -16%. GMXR -15%. TUES -13%. HL -13%. CTC -13%. AUMN -12%. RNIN -12%. RBPAA -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott (MDR -3.5%) is slammed on downgrades from Global Hunter and KeyBanc (I, II). MDR...

    McDermott (MDR -3.5%) is slammed on downgrades from Global Hunter and KeyBanc (I, II). MDR turned in a subpar Q4, but Hunter points to an elevated execution risk from the ongoing transition to deeper-water plays, which brings into question the ability to reliably convert backlog to earnings. KeyBanc sees costs rising more than expected and posing additional risk to achieving margin forecasts.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • AMAG

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +1.1%) moves up today after JPMorgan upped the shares earlier to...

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +1.1%) moves up today after JPMorgan upped the shares earlier to Neutral and bumped up its price target from $13.00 to $17.00. The firm says that fundamentals are improving and pricing for Feraheme has been trending positively over the past couple quarters. The company is also reducing its cash burn through cost savings, as well as pursuing a number of other value enhancing initiatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment (MTG +13.7%) is now up about 75% from its post-earnings low on Thursday, with...

    MGIC Investment (MTG +13.7%) is now up about 75% from its post-earnings low on Thursday, with news on the earnings call (I, II) that willing money is there should management decide to raise capital the apparent game-changer. With almost perfect timing, SA Pro author Oliver Davies last week said fans of soaring mortgage insurer Radian should instead take a look at MGIC (RDN continues to fly as well).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • HL

    Hecla's (HL -11.6%) C$796M bid for Aurizon (AZK +3.5%) adds underground mines similar to those...

    Hecla's (HL -11.6%) C$796M bid for Aurizon (AZK +3.5%) adds underground mines similar to those it already operates and reduces exposure to base metals by boosting its gold production, analysts say. But shares are plunging as the diversification effort is seen by investors as too costly; also noteworthy is the deal does not require shareholder approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • MRK

    Bank of America Merrill Lynch makes a couple valuation calls in healthcare this morning, upping...

    Bank of America Merrill Lynch makes a couple valuation calls in healthcare this morning, upping Merck (MRK +1.2%) to Buy on optimism over its osteoporosis drug, and moving to Neutral on Bristol-Myers (BMY -0.9%) due to its limited total-return potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NS -5.4%) is downgraded to Neutral from Outperform at Credit Suisse, which...

    NuStar Energy (NS -5.4%) is downgraded to Neutral from Outperform at Credit Suisse, which believes the company's distribution is again at risk to a cut following TexStar's termination of the NGL acquisition. Given the material impact of the failed transaction, the firm expects shares again will reflect the risk of a distribution cut.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 8 Comments
  • UAL

    As oil prices slip even further, margins for airline companies continue to look even more...

    As oil prices slip even further, margins for airline companies continue to look even more enticing to investors. The sector is also getting a nice boost from Delta Air Lines as the carrier forecast that Q1 will be its first profitable quarter since 2000. Advancers: UAL +4.5%, DAL +4.1%, ALK +3.0%, HA +2.6%, LCC +2.4%, SAVE +1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM

  • WTI crude (USO -1.4%) slips below $90/barrel for the first time this year with a renewed policy...

    WTI crude (USO -1.4%) slips below $90/barrel for the first time this year with a renewed policy hawkishness out of Beijing as good an excuse as any for the last few weeks' slide. Check out the correlation between oil and the China A Share ETF (CAF) since the start of February.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +13.5%) goes on a tear after announcing encouraging new data from its...

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +13.5%) goes on a tear after announcing encouraging new data from its clinical trial of PBT2, a treatment to reduce the damage to brain cells caused by the accumulation of the tau protein - a major protein associated with Alzheimer's Disease - and its ability to prevent subsequent cognitive impairment. Additionally, the company will be presenting an overview and update at Cowen's 33rd Annual Health Care Conference in Boston later this afternoon. Conference Webcast.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • NTR

    Agrium (AGU -2.1%) comes out firing again against Jana Partners, accusing the hedge fund of...

    Agrium (AGU -2.1%) comes out firing again against Jana Partners, accusing the hedge fund of hiding its real agenda and raising concerns about potential payouts to its director nominees. AGU, which has begun mailing its proxy circular to shareholders ahead of its annual meeting next month, says Jana's plan to split the company is an "ill-conceived scheme" that will destroy shareholder value.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS -2.5%) slides on concerns that it may be lowering the price of Qsymia just months...

    Vivus (VVUS -2.5%) slides on concerns that it may be lowering the price of Qsymia just months after commercial marketing began. Bloomberg's Andrew Berens says the company will start offering 30-days of medium-dose Qsymia for maximum out-of-pocket cost of $75, which is 70% below the current price. The move could pose risks for Arena's (ARNA -4.4%) Belviq, which is a competitor to Qsymia.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 6 Comments
  • SNBR

    An earnings warning from Select Comfort (SCSS -16.1%) is taking its toll on shares in early...

    An earnings warning from Select Comfort (SCSS -16.1%) is taking its toll on shares in early trading. Though the company says the issue is a short-term issue related to "accelerated changes" made to its media-buying strategy, investors aren't quite buying it on concerns a larger demand issue is in play.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • DGIT

    Digital Generation (NASDAQ:DGIT) gains 4.3% a day ahead of the expiration of the company's...

    Digital Generation (NASDAQ:DGIT) gains 4.3% a day ahead of the expiration of the company's poison pill. In addition to the CEO's purchase of stock last week was executive chairman Scott Ginsburg adding 13% to his stake by picking up about 270K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • HES

    Also from Hess (HES +4.4%) as it reveals plans to become a pure play in exploration and...

    Also from Hess (HES +4.4%) as it reveals plans to become a pure play in exploration and production is a shot at Paul Singer's Elliott Management, rejecting its suggested board members and saying it is convinced its transformation "is driving superior value creation far beyond Singer’s short-term time horizon." The hedge fund has said it wants Hess to exit businesses and spin off assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • BKS

    Will Microsoft buy Barnes & Noble (BKS +5.8%)? The bookstore chain shoots higher in early...

    Will Microsoft buy Barnes & Noble (BKS +5.8%)? The bookstore chain shoots higher in early trading after a Barron's article pitches the case that the retail business is worth $19 a share alone. The crux of the argument is that Microsoft (MSFT -0.2%) would be smart to buy the company to jumpstart its retail business and set up a store-within-a-store concept to boost sales of its tablets.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 8 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +2.9%) is higher in a down market after Barclays upgrades to Buy, citing the higher...

    Yahoo (YHOO +2.9%) is higher in a down market after Barclays upgrades to Buy, citing the higher valuation of the company's stake in Alibaba and the potential return of cash to shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • MFA

    MFA Financial (NYSE:MFA) gains 1.4% after figuring out prior periods' income exceeded...

    MFA Financial (NYSE:MFA) gains 1.4% after figuring out prior periods' income exceeded distributions paid to shareholders. The company declares a $0.50 special dividend and updates its book value to $9.40 on Jan. 31 from $8.99 a month earlier. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • ADY

    Feihe International (NYSE:ADY) +4.1% premarket after agreeing to be taken private in a deal...

    Feihe International (NYSE:ADY) +4.1% premarket after agreeing to be taken private in a deal financed by a group including Chairman/CEO You-Bin Leng that values the producer of dairy products at ~$146M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • OUTD

    Shares of Outdoor Channel Holdings (NASDAQ:OUTD) race 14.4% higher premarket after the company...

    Shares of Outdoor Channel Holdings (NASDAQ:OUTD) race 14.4% higher premarket after the company receives an offer from Kroenke Sports & Entertainment Group at $8.75 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures catch the downbeat mood emanating from China after the...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures catch the downbeat mood emanating from China after the country's government ratchets up its attempts to take the froth out the property market, with the S&P benchmark -0.1%. U.S.-listed Chinese property securities are especially suffering as Xinyuan Real Estate crumbles 12.5% and China HGS Real Estate drops 7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean's (NYSE:RIG) board recommends restarting dividend payments at $2.24/share - not the...

    Transocean's (NYSE:RIG) board recommends restarting dividend payments at $2.24/share - not the full $4/share Carl Icahn has advocated, but probably enough to satisfy many shareholders while maintaining balance sheet flexibility. RIG also says it will pay down $1B in debt by the end of 2014 in addition to its $1.36B of existing repayment obligations over the next two years. RIG +3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • FOE

    Premarket gainers: FOE +29%. OUTD +14%. MTG +8%. SSYS +7%.Losers: GMXR -32%. DRWI -23%. XIN...

    Premarket gainers: FOE +29%. OUTD +14%. MTG +8%. SSYS +7%.
    Losers: GMXR -32%. DRWI -23%. XIN -13%. HL -11%. RNIN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR) -27.7% premarket after receiving a non-compliance notice from the NYSE...

    GMX Resources (GMXR) -27.7% premarket after receiving a non-compliance notice from the NYSE for failure to reach $50M in market cap for 30 consecutive trading days. GMXR now has 45 days to submit a plan showing how it intends to comply with the NYSE's continued listing standards.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak Energy (NYSE:CLD) +2.5% premarket after shares are upgraded to Buy from Neutral at...

    Cloud Peak Energy (NYSE:CLD) +2.5% premarket after shares are upgraded to Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, which says a pullback in the stock presents an attractive opportunity. The firm expects supply discipline and improved demand to drive front month Henry Hub natural gas prices to average $4.25/MMBtu (from $3.48) and PRB coal prices to average $14/ton (from $9.10) by Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • HL

    U.S. silver miner Hecla Mining (NYSE:HL) agrees to acquire Canadian gold miner Aurizon Mines...

    U.S. silver miner Hecla Mining (NYSE:HL) agrees to acquire Canadian gold miner Aurizon Mines (AZK) for ~C$796M, nearly a month after AZK rejected an offer from Alamos Gold (NYSE:AGI). The offer price of C$4.75/share represents a 9% premium to Aurizon's Friday closing of C$4.35. HL -9%, AZK +6.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • EQC

    Corvex and Related Co. sue Commonwealth REIT (NYSE:CWH) seeking a temporary restraining offer to...

    Corvex and Related Co. sue Commonwealth REIT (NYSE:CWH) seeking a temporary restraining offer to prevent the closing of Commonwealth's secondary offering launched late last week. The two - owner's of 9.8% of the stock and tendering for the whole company - previously sued to prevent the offering in the first place. Shares -3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • FOE

    Ferro Corporation (NYSE:FOE) receives a buyout offer of $6.50/share in cash and stock from A....

    Ferro Corporation (NYSE:FOE) receives a buyout offer of $6.50/share in cash and stock from A. Schulman (NASDAQ:SHLM). The price represents a 25% premium to Friday's close. Schulman estimates the merger can achieve $35M in cost savings beyond Ferro's current targets. FOE +25% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • HES

    Hess (NYSE:HES) outlines steps to transform itself into a pure-play E&P company, planning to...

    Hess (NYSE:HES) outlines steps to transform itself into a pure-play E&P company, planning to fully exit all downstream businesses including retail, and energy marketing/trading. The company also  launches a buyback program of up to $4B and sets an increase in the annual dividend to $1 (from $0.40) beginning in Q3. Shares +4.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • RDN

    Red-hot mortgage insurer Radian (NYSE:RDN) - up 50% YTD, and nearly quadrupled from last...

    Red-hot mortgage insurer Radian (NYSE:RDN) - up 50% YTD, and nearly quadrupled from last summer's lows - is upgraded to Buy at Keefe Bruyette.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 AM

  • Shanghai plunges 3.7% after the government further cranks up property tightening measures, with...

    Shanghai plunges 3.7% after the government further cranks up property tightening measures, with a gauge of property developers falling 9.3%. "When there are new rules like these, it extends far beyond property shares," says an analyst. Industrial Bank -9.1%. FXI -1.8% premarket. Losses extend to Hong Kong, EWH -0.7% premarket, and the States, SPY -0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 AM | 11 Comments

  • European stocks take their cues from China and mostly fall in mid-morning trade, with miners...

    European stocks take their cues from China and mostly fall in mid-morning trade, with miners such as Rio Tinto (-2.5%) and BHP (-1.9%) suffering, while HSBC is -2.7% following its 2012 results. EU Stoxx 50 -0.4%, London -0.5%, Paris -0.2%, Frankfurt -0.5%, Milan -1.4%, Madrid +0.15%.

  • Asian stocks tread divergent paths as Japan hits 53-month highs before pulling back and closing...
